data:
Context and background:
The Scottish Government expect schools in Scotland to introduce the 1+2 Modern Languages policy, i.e. all pupils from Primary 1 (pupils aged 5) will begin to learn a modern foreign language  and a second language from Primary 5 (pupils aged 9).
Fife Council - our local authority - set up a group of 40 pilot schools to implement the 1 + 2 policy in different clusters across the region - in towns, in areas of deprivation and in rural areas in order to get a balanced representation of all schools in the authority. 

Objectives of the project: 
Our school has volunteered to be one of these pilot schools . Our highest priority and main objective  is to increase our teacher's competence and boost confidence in delivering exposure to Modern Languages. 

Number/Profile of Participants
After a presentation and selection process 3 of our teachers were identified as having a clear need to increase their language skills to allow them to gain greater confidence in delivering languages as part of the new curriculum.

Description of Activities:
To complement the training provided by the local authority, the 4 teachers will take part in  language immersion activities in Spain.  The course content has been adapted to meet the needs of our teachers provided - language teaching methodology in Early Years Education combined with gaining enhanced skills in the target language, therefore boosting confidence in speaking the target language.

Methodology to be used:
As head teacher I have identified with my teachers their development needs and looked for  high quality providers to run immersion courses abroad in conjunction with the Consejeria de Educacion
Together we have developed the course content to the specific needs of our teachers' requirements in line with advice for the new national curriculum in Scotland.
As head teacher I will monitor the experience of the course - there will be an evaluation of participants by the course provider
and a evaluation of course  by participants:
Through the evaluation of the course and the subsequent interview with each participating teacher I expect to get a clear picture of how successful / effective the course was.

Description of results/impact envisaged:
As head teacher I expect  longer term benefits as we are looking forward to our teachers becoming more fluent and more confident in their understanding and talking of the target language. Our pupils will greatly benefit from an enthused teacher who is able to speak accurately in the target language and will learn about foreign cultures first hand.

As part of implementing the government 1+2 language initiative the participant Susan Kellington, who is a class teacher and has responsibility for teaching French in the upper stages will embark on the week long immersion course in Primary French in Salignac. Through the course she will be immersed in the French language, experience the culture of France, meet peers with responsibility for teaching French to create a learning network and EU links, learn new ideas and methodologies for teaching French in the primary school and share resources to support implementation. Following the course it is expected that she will then cascade this learning to staff within the school and begin to develop a programme of work to roll out the teaching of French from P1 to P7. This will involve supporting staff with training, planning, implementing and displaying French. She will continue to teach French in the upper stages. As part of the initiative she will be required to engage with parents explaining her background to the project, the learning that has taken place as well as introducing the initiative and what it means for the children. She will be involved in budget discussions when considering resources to be purchased to support the teaching of French and allocating these to appropriate stages of the school. The long term goal is for a progressive programme of work to be in place from P1 to P7 and with school staff showing confidence to deliver French lessons at their appropriate stage. She will share her experiences at cluster French meetings and with high school staff as part of transition. She will also liaise with the coordinator for Primary French in the region to relay her experiences and any useful knowledge gained with the view that this can be shared further within the region.
